intro: Elaphrium acuminatum, commonly known as the slender rock cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and alpine environments. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has thin, hairy stems and linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and bloom in early spring. Elaphrium acuminatum is often found in dry, well-drained soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude conditions.
